questions.question: Which of the following is a type of memory module commonly used in desktop computers?
questions.explanation: DIMM (Dual In-Line Memory Module) is a type of memory module commonly used in desktop computers to provide system memory (RAM).

questions.question: A user reports that their computer is not connecting to the wireless network. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should be performed first?
options: Check if the Wi-Fi switch on the computer is turned on
questions.answer: Check if the Wi-Fi switch on the computer is turned on
questions.explanation: Before performing any other troubleshooting steps, it is important to check if the Wi-Fi switch on the computer is turned on. Sometimes, users accidentally turn off the Wi-Fi switch, leading to connectivity issues.

questions.question: A customer wants to purchase a new smartphone with a large screen and long battery life. Which of the following specifications should the customer look for?
questions.explanation: For a smartphone with a large screen and long battery life, the customer should look for a high battery capacity. A larger battery capacity allows the phone to power the large screen for a longer duration.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of solid-state drives (SSDs) compared to traditional hard disk drives (HDDs)? SSDs are _________.
questions.explanation: Solid-state drives (SSDs) are faster compared to traditional hard disk drives (HDDs). SSDs use flash memory for storage, which allows for faster data access and retrieval.

questions.question: A user is unable to print a document. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should be performed first?
options: Check if the printer is powered on
questions.answer: Check if the printer is powered on
questions.explanation: Before performing any other troubleshooting steps, it is important to check if the printer is powered on. Sometimes, users forget to turn on the printer, resulting in printing issues.

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct order of the four stages in the troubleshooting process?
questions.explanation: The correct order of the four stages in the troubleshooting process is: Identify, Research, Implement, Test. First, identify the problem and gather information. Then, research possible solutions. Next, implement the chosen solution. Finally, test the solution to ensure it resolves the problem.

questions.question: A user wants to set up a new email account on their mobile device. Which of the following information is required to configure the email account?
options: Email address, password, and server type
Phone number, password, and email address
Email address, server type, and email client
Phone number, server type, and email client
questions.answer: Email address, password, and server type
questions.explanation: To configure a new email account on a mobile device, the user typically needs to provide their email address, password, and server type (e.g., IMAP or POP3). This information is used to establish a connection with the email server.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a Class C IP address?
questions.explanation: 192.168.1.1 is an example of a Class C IP address. Class C addresses have their first octet range from 192 to 223, providing a large number of network addresses for smaller organizations.

questions.question: A user reports that their computer is running very slowly and often freezes. Which of the following could be a possible cause of the issue?
questions.explanation: Insufficient RAM (Random Access Memory) can cause a computer to run slowly and freeze. When the system runs out of available RAM, it may rely heavily on virtual memory, which can significantly degrade performance.

questions.question: Which of the following connectors is commonly used to connect a keyboard to a computer?
questions.explanation: USB (Universal Serial Bus) is commonly used to connect a keyboard to a computer. USB keyboards are widely supported and provide a convenient plug-and-play experience.

questions.question: Which of the following mobile device features allows users to quickly unlock their device by scanning their fingerprint?
questions.explanation: A fingerprint scanner is a mobile device feature that allows users to quickly unlock their device by scanning their fingerprint. The device compares the scanned fingerprint with the stored fingerprint data for authentication.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid IPv6 address format?
questions.explanation: 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334 is a valid IPv6 address format. IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long and are represented in eight groups of four hexadecimal digits separated by colons.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common video port used to connect a computer to an external display?
questions.explanation: HDMI (High-Definition Multimedia Interface) is a common video port used to connect a computer to an external display. HDMI supports high-definition video and audio signals.

questions.question: A user is unable to access the internet on their computer. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should be performed first?
options: Check if the network cable is securely plugged in
questions.answer: Check if the network cable is securely plugged in
questions.explanation: Before performing any other troubleshooting steps, it is important to check if the network cable is securely plugged in. A loose or disconnected network cable can cause loss of internet connectivity.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an input device?
questions.explanation: A keyboard is an example of an input device. Input devices are used to enter data and commands into a computer system.
